newsitem.title: ROMANIA: ING BANK ARRANGES $160 MLN LOAN FOR ROMANIA RENEL.
newsitem.headline: ING BANK ARRANGES $160 MLN LOAN FOR ROMANIA RENEL.

text.p: ING Bank of the Netherlands said on Thursday it was mandated to arrange a $160 million syndicated letter of credit to help the country's electicity authority Renel RA fund fuel imports.

"The syndicated letter of credit and post-import financing loan facility is guaranteed by the Romanian state...and is available to cover Romanian fuel oil imports," the Bucharest branch of ING Bank said in a statement.

Earlier this month, Renel said it would spend $160 million to import fuel oil for its power plants in the coming winter months. Western oil dealers confirmed Renel would buy around 500,000 tonnes of high sulphur fuel oil over the next month.
Last winter, the state-run Renel cut power supplies to industry over January-March due to an acute shortage of hard currency which triggered a sharp cut of crude imports.
The Industry Ministry said recently Romania would import 2.4 million tonnes of crude over the next three months. It said domestic output for the rest of the year would total 1.5 million tonnes.
The country extracts some 6.6 million tonnes (132,000 bpd) of crude annually.

The ING Bank was among the first foreign banks to come to the Balkan country after the 1989 fall of communism. It opened a branch in Bucharest two years ago and plans to launch a new unit in the western city of Timisoara next month. -- Mirela Eremia, Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
